function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dependence on AI-driven tools for clinical, epidemiological, and public health data may lead to errors or biases in decision-making.","Impact":"Ineffective control of disease spread, economic disruption, and adverse impact on people's lives.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and auditing of AI tools, coupled with human oversight and intervention.","Technologies":"Validation algorithms, human-in-the-loop AI systems.","People":"Health authorities, decision-makers, general public.","Owner":"AI developers, health authorities."},{"Description":"Limited use of AI in LMICs may perpetuate health inequalities and increase the burden on healthcare systems in those countries.","Impact":"Widening disparities in disease control and healthcare access, leading to higher morbidity and mortality rates.","Mitigation":"Investment in AI infrastructure, capacity building, and technology transfer to LMICs.","Technologies":"AI education and training programs, technology transfer initiatives.","People":"Population in LMICs, healthcare workers, policymakers.","Owner":"Donor organizations, international health agencies."},{"Description":"Potential for reliance on AI to overlook contextual and cultural factors in disease control and treatment, leading to suboptimal outcomes in certain communities.","Impact":"Inequitable access to effective treatment, failure to address sociocultural determinants of health.","Mitigation":"Integration of sociocultural data into AI algorithms, interdisciplinary collaboration with social scientists and anthropologists.","Technologies":"Data integration platforms, interdisciplinary collaboration tools.","People":"Community members from diverse cultural backgrounds, healthcare providers, public health experts.","Owner":"Interdisciplinary research institutions, public health organizations."}]}
